about_the_game:
1934. World War I never ended. You are a convict. Good Luck 

Decend by yourself or with friends down into the old fighting tunnels under the front lines of France. Search for old equipment and complete objectives for king and country… but mostly to keep the oxygen pumps on. 

Exploration

The underground tunnels caves and mines of France have expanded over years of stalemate warfare. There are seemingly endless routes and floors all with a mix of handmade and generated levels to search through.

Patchwork Parts

As you explore you might find old equipment from past combat, use these tools to aid your exploration, set traps, and create elaborate explosive arrays. Items do break but don't worry there are plenty of resources down there for you.

Find Friends and Expand Your Base

Not everyone underground is out to get you. Sometimes you might find someone willing to return to your home base. They can provide services from fixing your gear to uncovering special missions for your team to embark on.

Go on Crazier Missions 

You may find as you journey further and further down that things change… low light and a lack of oxygen can really make you see some strange things. 

Co-Op or Solo

Whether you're a solo or collaborative convict you will share a from a limited pool of soldiers. More players also means more breaths and less oxygen you get per level.

Crafted or Chaos

With a highly destructible environment and lots of tools at your disposal, you could set out a structured plan of attack or just go with your guns…literally. Both strategies are workable, but you may need to communicate with your team before you run in.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: 64-bit Windows 10
  • Processor: INTEL CORE I5-8400 or AMD RYZEN 3 3300X
  • Memory: 12 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 3GB or AMD Radeon RX 570 4GB
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 12 GB available space

short_description: Decend by yourself or with friends down into the old fighting tunnels under France. Search for old equipment and complete objectives for king and country… but mostly to keep the oxygen pumps on. Earn your freedom through careful subterranean strategy or chaotic run-and-gun gameplay.
